tiles.title: Highest temperature increase by 2050 per RCP 2.6 (optimistic) scenario (°C) in Counties of California
Highest temperature increase by 2050 per RCP 2.6 (optimistic) scenario (°C) in Counties of California

blocks.description: Highest temperature likely to be reached by 2050 compared to average observed max temperature of 30 years. Reported values are differences in temperature.
blocks.footnote: RCP 2.6 is likely to keep global temperature rise below 2 °C by 2100.
blocks.title: Projected highest increase in max temperature in different scenarios

tiles.title: Highest temperature increase by 2050 per RCP 4.5 (intermediate) scenario (°C) in Counties of California
Highest temperature increase by 2050 per RCP 4.5 (intermediate) scenario (°C) in Counties of California

blocks.footnote: RCP 4.5 is more likely than not to result in global temperature rise between 2 °C and 3 °C by 2100.

tiles.title: Highest temperature increase by 2050 per RCP 6.0 (slightly pessimistic) scenario (°C) in Counties of California
Highest temperature increase by 2050 per RCP 6.0 (slightly pessimistic) scenario (°C) in Counties of California

blocks.footnote: RCP 6.0 simulates conditions through 2100 making the global temperature rise between 3 °C and 4 °C by 2100.

tiles.title: Highest temperature decrease by 2050 per RCP 2.6 (optimistic) scenario (°C) in Counties of California
Highest temperature decrease by 2050 per RCP 2.6 (optimistic) scenario (°C) in Counties of California

blocks.description: Lowest temperature likely to be reached by 2050 compared to average observed min temperature of 30 years. Reported values are differences in temperature.
blocks.footnote: RCP 2.6 is likely to keep global temperature rise below 2 °C by 2100.
blocks.title: Projected highest decrease in min temperature in different scenarios
